description: Smallest number that takes n steps to get to 1 under the map f(n)=sigma(n)-n, the sum of the proper divisors.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..150
example: a(4)=14 since 14->10->8->7->1 and no smaller number takes 4 steps.
mathematica: f[n_] := DivisorSigma[1, n] - n; f[1] = 1; a[n_] := Catch[For[k = 1, True, k++, nl = NestList[f, k, n]; p = Position[nl, 1, 1, 1]; If[p != {}, If[p[[1, 1]] - 1 == n, Throw[k]]]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 52}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Feb 01 2013 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A003023 (length of aliquot sequence for n).
author: _Erich Friedman_, Feb 02 2001
extensions: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Nov 27 2006
